title: Guanaco
summary: The guanaco (Lama guanicoe) is a camelid native to South America, closely related to the llama. Its name comes from the Quechua word huanaco[2] (modern spelling wanaku). Young guanacos are called chulengos.[3] Guanacos are one of two wild South American camelids, the other being the vicu√±a, which lives at higher elevations.
